section.title: Removing a Swift Node
section.para: Removal process for both Swift Object and PAC nodes.
You can use this process when you want to remove one or more Swift nodes permanently. This process applies to both Swift Proxy, Account, Container (PAC) nodes and Swift Object nodes.

section.title: Setting the Pass-through Attributes
section.para: This process will remove the Swift node's drives from the rings and move it to the remaining nodes in your cluster.

listitem.para: Log in to the &lcm;.
Ensure that the weight-step attribute is set. See for more details.

Add the pass-through definition to your input model, specifying the server ID (as opposed to the server name). It is easiest to include in your ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file since your server IDs are already listed in that file. For more information about pass-through, see .
Here is the general format:
Here is an example:
listitem.screen:
--- product: version: 2
pass-through: servers: - id: ccn-0001 data: swift: drain: yes
listitem.para: By setting this pass-through attribute, you indicate that the system should reduce the weight of the server's drives. The weight reduction is determined by the weight-step attribute as described in the previous step. This process is known as "draining", where you remove the Swift data from the node in preparation for removing the node.
Commit your configuration to the local Git repository (see ), as follows:
listitem.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

listitem.para: If the number of partitions is zero for the server on all rings, you can move to the next step, otherwise continue the ring rebalance cycle by repeating steps 7-9 until the weight has reached zero.

If the number of partitions is zero for the server on all rings, you can remove the Swift nodes' drives from all rings. Edit the pass-through data you created in step #3 and set the remove attribute as shown in this example:
listitem.screen:
--- product: version: 2
pass-through: servers: - id: ccn-0001 data: swift: remove: yes

Run the Swift deploy playbook to rebuild the rings by removing the server:

At this stage, the server has been removed from the rings and the data that was originally stored on the server has been replicated in a balanced way to the other servers in the system. You can proceed to the next phase.

section.title: To Remove a Node from the Input Model
section.para: Use the following steps to finish the process of removing the Swift node.

listitem.para: Log in to the &lcm;.
Edit the ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file and remove the entry for the node (swobj4 in this example).
If this was a SWPAC node, reduce the member-count attribute by 1 in the ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file. For SWOBJ nodes, no such action is needed.
Commit your configuration to the local Git repository (see ), as follows:
listitem.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

listitem.para: Run the configuration processor:
You may want to use the remove_deleted_servers and free_unused_addresses switches to free up the resources when running the configuration processor. For more information, see .

Validate the changes you have made to the configuration files using the playbook below before proceeding further:

section.title: Remove the Swift Node from Monitoring
section.para: Once you have removed the Swift node(s), the alarms against them will trigger so there are additional steps to take to resolve this issue.

You will want to SSH to each of the Monasca API servers and edit the /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/host_alive.yaml file to remove references to the Swift node(s) you removed. This will require sudo access.
